intro: Secamone penangiana, commonly known as Penang secamone, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are often followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
